page.title: 02THE RIVER TARRANT
page.content: ON WEDNESDAY 19TH JUNE SOME OF US WALKED UP OF THE RIVER TARRANT.WE STARTED JUST SOUTH OF TARRANT RAWSTON FARM OPPOSITE ADDISON COTTAGES AND WALKED NORTH TO LUTON FARM. AT FIRST THE RIVER WAS 60 CM DEEP.IT WAS 12 CM DEEP AT LUTON FARM.THE BED OF THE RIVER WAS STONEY AND THE BANK WAS ABOUT 1 METRE HIGH. THERE WERE A LOT OF WATER PLANTS EXCEPT IN THE PARTS WHERE THE CATTLE HAD BEEN GRAZING.WE WENT PAST OR UNDER THE ROAD BRIDGE AT TARRANT RAWSTON.IT WAS DARK AND LOW DOWN. THERE WERE TWO SECTIONS AND THE WALLS WERE SLIMEY AND SLIPPERY. THE WATER WAS VERY SHALLOW. AT TARRANT RAWSTON FARM THERE WAS A SMALL WEIR. AT THE SIDE OF THE WEIR,IN A SMALL BRICK HUT, THERE WAS AN UNDERSHOOT WATER WHEEL.THIS PUMPS WATER UP TO THE FARM FOR USE IN THE DAIRY.
